generif.text: ADAMTS-7 is the first metalloproteinase found to bind directly to and degrade COMP
ADAMTS-7 and ADAMTS-12 are newly identified enzymes responsible for cartilage oligomeric matrix protein degradation in arthritis.
Findings demonstrate that ADAMTS-7, a direct target of PTHrP signaling, negatively regulates endochondral bone formation by associating with and inactivating GEP chondrogenic growth factor.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
identified ADAMTS7 as novel locus for CAD and association of ABO with MI in the presence of CAD
statistically significant increase in mRNA expression of ADAMTS-7 and ADAMTS-12 was observed in the endplate cells in degenerative discs compared with nondegenerative discs
There was a reduction in the amount of cleaved ADAMTS7 prodomain in media conditioned by VSMCs of the G/G genotype.

Data conclude that ADAMTS-7 level appears to be positively associated with expression of TNF-alpha and Phospho-NF-kappaB P65 in cartilage, which may imply its association with cartilage destruction of ONFH.

ADAMTS7 localized to cells having smooth muscle cell markers in human coronary artery disease lesions. Cultured vascular smooth muscle cells had ADAMTS7 at the cytoplasm and cell membrane, where it colocalized with markers of podosomes.
Logistic regression analysis indicated that the association between ADAMTS-7 and heart failure after AMI was independent from traditional cardiovascular risk factors and other biomarkers
The significant associations observed between this coding variant in ADAMTS7 and the risk of CAD development.
Our results indicate the presence of ADAMTS-7 in human NP cells and imply its potential role in disc degeneration.
miR-105/Runx2 axis mediates FGF2-induced ADAMTS expression in osteoarthritis cartilage.
The main contribution of this study is the proposal of a pharmacophore for ADAMTS7.

Expression of miR-26a and miR-29a was significantly down regulated in leukoplakia and cancer tissues but up regulated in lichen planus tissues. Expression of target genes such as, ADAMTS7, ATP1B1, COL4A2, CPEB3, CDK6, DNMT3a and PI3KR1 was significantly down regulated in at least two of three disease types with respect to normal tissues.
During inflammatory conditions, AP-1 and Sp1 sustained the expression of ADAMTS7, and ADAMTS7 sustained the expression of catabolic genes in nucleus pulposus cells
The native overfunctional ADAMTS7 allele (A) may accelerate VSMC migration and lead to neointimal thickening, atherosclerosis progression and acute plaque events.
ADAMTS7 and LPA single nucleotide polymorphisms are related to a 24-h ambulatory systolic-diastolic pressure regression index.

Studied gene expression of genetic variants of ADAMTS7 in atherosclerotic occlusive peripheral arterial disease (PAD). Found mRNA levels of ADAMTS7 to be significantly higher in PAD patients than controls, and that the rs1994016 CC and rs3825807 TT genotypes may upregulate ADAMTS7 mRNA levels and may influence PAD development.
Allelic variation that associates with reduced ADAMTS7 expression confers stronger coronary heart disease protection in never-smokers than in ever-smokers.
data show that ADAMTS-7 is associated with a vulnerable plaque phenotype in human carotid lesions. These data support previous observations of a potential proatherogenic role of ADAMTS-7.
The findings suggest that upregulation of ADAMTS-7 and down regulation of COMP are associated with human AA.
Genetic variation at the ADAMTS7 locus is associated with reduced severity of coronary artery disease.
Multivariate analysis showed that DeltaADAMTS-7(day 7 minus day 1) was independently associated with left ventricular reverse remodeling

Degenerated human biceps tendons had reduced ADAMTS7 mRNA compared with healthy biceps tendons, which expressed both ADAMTS7 and ADAMTS12. These results suggest that ADAMTS7 and ADAMTS12 may be essential for human tendon health.
Serum ADAMTS7 level is positively associated with acute coronary syndrome, and patients with the CT/TT genotype at the rs1994016 allele are less prone to suffer from ACS.
presents the expression levels of ADAMTS-7 and COMP in the decidual tissues of mice and humans suffering from SA.
findings reveal LTBP4 as an ADAMTS7 substrate, whose cleavage may potentially impact elastogenesis in the cardiovascular system.
ADAMTS7 tagSNP rs3825807 contributes to MI susceptibility in the Chinese Han population.
Genetic variants of ADAMTS7 confer risk for ischaemic stroke in the Chinese population.

ADAMTS7 polymorphisms of both rs7173743 and rs3825807 were associated with carotid plaque vulnerability but not the prevalence of ischemic stroke. The T/T genotype of rs7173743 and A/A genotype of rs3825807 were considered as risk genotypes for vulnerable plaque susceptibility. In conclusion, ADAMTS7 variants rs3825807 and rs7173743 are associated with the risk for carotid plaque vulnerability.

Data show that common variants in A disintegrin and metalloproteinase with thrombospondin motifs 7 protein (ADAMTS7) and zinc finger, C3HC-type containing 1 protein (ZC3HC1) genes contribute to an increased risk for both coronary artery disease (CAD) and large artery ischemic stroke (LA atherosclerotic) IS.
Upregulation of miR423 improves autologous vein graft restenosis via targeting ADAMTS7.
Effect of a coronary-heart-disease-associated variant of ADAMTS7 on endothelial cell angiogenesis.
ADATMS-7 regulates the focal adhesion kinase signaling and promotes invasiveness of trophoblasts in early pregnancy.
Hypomethylation of DNA promoter upregulates ADAMTS7 and contributes to HTR-8/SVneo and JEG-3 cells abnormalities in pre-eclampsia.
ADAMTS7 degrades Comp to fuel BMP2-dependent osteogenic differentiation and ameliorate oncogenic potential in osteosarcomas.

Coronary Disease Association With ADAMTS7 Is Due to Protease Activity.
Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis of coronary artery disease and pneumonia identifies shared immune pathways.
miR-654-5p Suppresses Migration and Proliferation of Vascular Smooth Muscle Cells by Targeting ADAMTS-7.
ADAMTS-7 deficiency attenuates thoracic aortic aneurysm and dissection in mice.
ADAMTS-7 Modulates Atherosclerotic Plaque Formation by Degradation of TIMP-1.
The Association of ADAMTS7 Gene Polymorphisms with the Risk of Coronary Artery Disease Occurrence and Cardiovascular Survival in the Polish Population: A Case-Control and a Prospective Cohort Study.

name: ADAM metallopeptidase with thrombospondin type 1 motif 7
other_names: A disintegrin and metalloproteinase with thrombospondin motifs 7
a disintegrin and metalloprotease with thrombospondin motifs-7 preproprotein
a disintegrin-like and metalloprotease (reprolysin type) with thrombospondin type 1 motif, 7

reactome.name: Diseases associated with O-glycosylation of proteins

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the ADAMTS (a disintegrin and metalloproteinase with thrombospondin motifs) family. Members of this family share several distinct protein modules, including a propeptide region, a metalloproteinase domain, a disintegrin-like domain, and a thrombospondin type 1 (TS) motif. Individual members of this family differ in the number of C-terminal TS motifs, and some have unique C-terminal domains. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate the mature enzyme. This enzyme contains two C-terminal TS motifs and may regulate vascular smooth muscle cell (VSMC) migration. Mutations in this gene may be associated with susceptibility to coronary artery disease. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2016].
